name: Po de Queijo (Brazilian Cheese Bread)
author: Salads4me
summary: I grew up eating these tasty treats. Always served at the table as an appetizer prior to salad. Totally delicious.
ingredients: 2 cups finely grated Pecorino Romano cheese
directions: Heat half-and-half, vegetable, and salt together in a saucepan over medium heat; constantly whisk until mixture just starts to boil, about 5 minutes
Remove from heat and pour mixture into a large deep bowl
Stir tapioca flour into half-and-half mixture using a wooden spoon
Cool to room temperature, about 20 minutes
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Mix Pecorino Romano cheese and eggs into tapioca mixture using an electric mixer or by hand until dough has a paste-like texture
Continue mixing until dough is soft and stretchy
Roll dough into 2- or 3-inch balls and arrange on a baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese balls are puffed and hardened on the outside, 20 to 25 minutes
